text: The Australian Classification Board is a government agency in Australia that controls censorship and classifications. It rates video games, movies, and publications. It was originally created in 1970 as the Office of Film and Literature Classification (OFLC). The name was changed in 2006. For most media, there are the following ratings: Rating symbol Meaning ; E: Exempt ; G: General ; PG: Parental Guidance ; M: Mature 15+ ; MA15+: Mature Accompanied ; R18+: Restricted 18+ ; X18+: Restricted 18+ ;RC: Refused Classification ;CTC: Check the Classification Refused Classification means that the Classification Board has banned the item from being released in Australia. Any movie or video game under this rating can not be shown in Australia. RC would be the strongest rating by the Australian Classification Board. ==References== Category:1970 establishments in Oceania Category:1970s establishments in Australia Category:Censorship Category:Government agencies of Australia Category:Movie ratings Category:Video game content rating systems
title: Australian Classification Board
